list.name: Default
list.comment: Fix #10, #11, #12, #14, #15, #16, and #17, added tutorial/credits. Also refactored players from a dictionary to a list. Fixed the issues listed, addressed a bit of #7 by moving the player dictionary to a list instead (This helped simplify a lot of code). Added a couple new player types to help unify the customization of players. Refactored the add_players function so that each type of Player only has to determine what class each player should be and the rest is handled. Adjusted the size of a few buttons. Removed the "Border change on action change" feature that has been around for a while. Got the easter working again. Laid down a few more changes (mostly renaming files) that'll make it easier to just swap out icons when the new ones are completed. Hei Jing completed the tutorial and credits menus, so we now have those. Documentation will most likely come in the next update, as well as a lot of refactoring.

task.summary: Style and Syntax Fixes Fix random errors in the style or syntax of files across the project. For more information view the diff. These changes were found through PyCharm's code inspection tool.

Game Logic Update Add in the rest of the game logic, making the game somewhat playable Added in the rest of the checks for each stage, implemented mafia, added a very simple proto-reasoner to simulate an external agent, added in logger messages, cleaned up a little bit of the code, added in some checks so that in the event of bugs dead players can't do anything.
The end game logic still needs to be implemented and the code desperately needs refactored, we also need to add in a display for which players are accusing and suspecting one another in the Discussion stage, but other than that the game is somewhat playable.

End Game Update Added end-game scenario, fixed a few bugs, improved UIX Added win scenarios for mafia and townies, fixed new-game bugs, made it so that (in the discussion stage) clicking an action then clicking another player deselects the acting player.

UI Update and minor code cleanup Added a display in the discussion stage, changed the logo, cleaned code Tried to remove useless comments and reorganize the code a tiny amount, added the required action display to the discussion stage, added an animated logo :D
Add shebang line Added a shebang line to run.sh I'm not saying it again :P
Address #4 Added a Mafia display to Discussion

Fix #10, #11, #12, #14, #15, #16, and #17, added tutorial/credits. Also refactored players from a dictionary to a list. Fixed the issues listed, addressed a bit of #7 by moving the player dictionary to a list instead (This helped simplify a lot of code). Added a couple new player types to help unify the customization of players. Refactored the add_players function so that each type of Player only has to determine what class each player should be and the rest is handled. Adjusted the size of a few buttons. Removed the "Border change on action change" feature that has been around for a while. Got the easter egg working again. Laid down a few more changes (mostly renaming files) that'll make it easier to just swap out icons when the new ones are completed. Hei Jing completed the tutorial and credits menus, so we now have those. Documentation will most likely come in the next update, as well as a lot of refactoring.

MESSAGE.value: Style and Syntax Fixes Fix random errors in the style or syntax of files across the project. For more information view the diff. These changes were found through PyCharm's code inspection tool.

Game Logic Update Add in the rest of the game logic, making the game somewhat playable Added in the rest of the checks for each stage, implemented mafia, added a very simple proto-reasoner to simulate an external agent, added in logger messages, cleaned up a little bit of the code, added in some checks so that in the event of bugs dead players can't do anything.
The end game logic still needs to be implemented and the code desperately needs refactored, we also need to add in a display for which players are accusing and suspecting one another in the Discussion stage, but other than that the game is somewhat playable.

End Game Update Added end-game scenario, fixed a few bugs, improved UIX Added win scenarios for mafia and townies, fixed new-game bugs, made it so that (in the discussion stage) clicking an action then clicking another player deselects the acting player.

UI Update and minor code cleanup Added a display in the discussion stage, changed the logo, cleaned code Tried to remove useless comments and reorganize the code a tiny amount, added the required action display to the discussion stage, added an animated logo :D
Add shebang line Added a shebang line to run.sh I'm not saying it again :P
Address #4 Added a Mafia display to Discussion

Fix #10, #11, #12, #14, #15, #16, and #17, added tutorial/credits. Also refactored players from a dictionary to a list. Fixed the issues listed, addressed a bit of #7 by moving the player dictionary to a list instead (This helped simplify a lot of code). Added a couple new player types to help unify the customization of players. Refactored the add_players function so that each type of Player only has to determine what class each player should be and the rest is handled. Adjusted the size of a few buttons. Removed the "Border change on action change" feature that has been around for a while. Got the easter egg working again. Laid down a few more changes (mostly renaming files) that'll make it easier to just swap out icons when the new ones are completed. Hei Jing completed the tutorial and credits menus, so we now have those. Documentation will most likely come in the next update, as well as a lot of refactoring.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE

Refactored the add_players function so that each type of Player only has to determine what class each player should be and the rest is handled. Adjusted the size of a few buttons. Removed the "Border change on action change" feature that has been around for a while. Got the easter egg working again. Laid down a few more changes (mostly renaming files) that'll make it easier to just swap out icons when the new ones are completed.
